content:
Posted: March 27
Early Access Review
								As someone who just started in this game and has a very good idea of how to play and is now faced with a major wipe coming up in april causing me to lose most of my ships,gold and items (besides xp) here is my opinion. First, if your planning to get the game i would wait until after april 20th, this is when the wipe will be done and the servers back open again. You might not want to buy now and invest time just to lose your stuff in a few weeks. <-- nothing against the game but i am trying to help new or soon to be new players out in the frustation department. Review of the game itself:Naval action has to be one of the best age of sail games on the market right now. Graphics=Unbeatable...Gameplay=Immersive/entertaining  Realism and Historical ships=Included. This game has to be one of the most edge of your seat age of sail games ever, between tradeing port to port hopeing pirates dont spot your ship to intense port and massive ship battles to one on one broadsides with high detail cannon fire this game has the makings of a amazing naval game with all the goodies you want. Mind you...Makeings...This is a keyword, currently the game is in alpha, before you buy...PLEASE understand what this means! This means, nothing is guarenteed. Your hard earned work, your gold your ships and XP could all be taken away in a wipe to improve the game. The game is in development and wipes are needed to make this game better before final relieace. if your someone who will be sore having your 10 million dollar ship taken from you in a wipe you may not want to pick this game up until it is finished. Personally, i enjoy the game. i enjoy the battles and the sailing i enjoy having to use the map cordinate points to sail since their is no waypoints or navagation help in the game. I enjoy working hard and being told "hey, we are going to make this better for you, we know ____ is causeing you to grind for xp let us wipe and make this better and more enjoyable." i like being apart of a game whos devs literally have a thread open all the time for you to post complaints or issues. I like to see the devs comment on threads that are related to the game. But hey, having your stuff taken from you isnt for everyone. Please think about this before buying this game i give it a 8.0 out of 10 even as a alpha currently, but think about if a wipe would make you upset. or a learning curve to even play the game first.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								     Naval Action is a completely new experience, a game of this scale and type hasn't been attempted at development for a long while after games such as Sea Dogs II (Later on bought by Disney and renamed to Pirates of the Caribbean) and so far a great product has come of it. Game-Labs have a team of very talented and dedicated people, which unlike many they are very community driven, you will see them answering questions and taking part of pretty much all forum posts. Overall this game has the potential to become a lot. So don't be disappointed if there's things missing, instead log into the forums and help out and this game can become something very special. I've been helping with testing and development like many others for over a year and I can say that this game has changed A LOT and very quickly. All the little things have been looked after by Game-Labs so that the game works and so that it is balanced for everyone to enjoy. So far I have loved my experience and I know that many of you will.              Regards                   -TheMarineGamerRemember, in this world, it's your choice, it's your path and do whatever you like because the game lets you do so!So if you don't like the fact you need to use common sense to know where you are and use visual landmarks, or if you think that the game is too hard, then instead of trying to change this one, just play games that are already like that, such as POTBS. Because this game im afraid is just for the other 'minority'. And we're loving it, same goes for Elite Dangerous!

Early Access Review
								IMPORTANT: If you're someone who likes to get into a game and play it just fine, this isn't for you. Maybe because it's early access, but to understand everything, you'll need to look up stuff on the game official forum or ask on the steam forum ( who has a very low population compared to the real forum tho ).The game is very well made for an early access, I've owned this game since it's very very early access where you purchased it on their website and they sent keys by wave. There's a lot going on and the game mechanics are very good. But it's really ''realistic'', it's not an arcade kind of game like how you fight with ships in black flag, so if you're into that instead of something more up to par with real life standards, I'd recommend you skip this game.The graphics are very good & I never had any lag ( playing this game on a 560M than on a 960 ), obviously there are some bugs, but it's pretty good looking so far.The only thing that is a downer ( for me at least ), is the price tag, 55$ CAD is fairly expensive for an early access game, and I feel it may pose problems for future sales.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								(UPDATE: Just avoid like the plaugue. Planned microtransactions, premium ships only for mods and admins, and rich kids who can buy the other premium ships. Requests to downvote reviews, closing topics, banning users and REMOVING PLANNED CONTENT because of an unhappy playerbase. These guys are among the worst developers in the business. This experiement of a game has failed, time to wait for the next big hope, run by people that actually care about the community)In the time I played I never felt a connection to anything. Big wide open spaces, npc ships. It felt like a lot of effort to go somewhere that looks and feels the same as every other spot. The water was not exciting. No big battles with giant whitecapping waves, rocking the ships, making you fight the waves and time your shots. Instead it feels arcady. Still fun, but lacking those moments of intense excitment and real skill that mother nature randomly provides. Wind should change during battle... why remove reality, when it would be a solid addition to the gameplay mechanics?I love that you can see the shore now in battle, and use it as a tool. This makes the wind direction actually important (wind that changed direction could be a real challange). Remaining in aiming view when looking around that ship would really help keep the immersion in battle, but instead looking around to get your bearings is penalized with a game mechanic that is a little jolting. What I would give for life to be in the ocean and land to look at as I walk along the line of my ship, maybe even enter my cabin, as the men run about taking care of the ship. Important things to keep the immersion, as most of the time in the game is spent in transition from one place to another. Instead we can only look at a stripped down version of our actual ship, dead seas, and calm sailing, with storms so weak they are easily missed. There is potential here, the question is: will it be realised? I think it is imporant for developers to listen to the community and seriously consider if they are doing the right thing or not.

All and all solid battle mechanic and a complete fail at being a MMO in every way shape and form.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a game that I really want to like. I love sailing ships, I love naval combat. And this game is maybe 75% of the way there.But here's the thing. There's literally no explanation of any mechanics in the game. I mean not a single one, there's no help page. No tooltips. No explanation of what things on the Worlds Worst UI do. No explanation about settings and things you can toggle on your ship. If you want to find any of this out, you have to go dig around the game forums, and read explanations of things that are out of date or don't help at all.The players in game don't really answer questions either. I've seen several lost new players asking questions, and being ignored by the veterans in the chat channels. The playerbase obviously isn't putting any effort into helping the new people get a grip on a complex game.The progression is absolutely glacial. I've played for 8 hours now, and haven't even gotten halfway through the first captain level. Even the gameplay gets glacial, once your ship takes enough damage and your crew takes enough casualties (about 5 maybe, it's insane) everything takes longer to do. Guns reload so slow you could watch a youtube video in between shots. Don't get me wrong, I'm a fan of slower-paced games, and wouldn't like to see this game turn arcadey. But as it stands, the pacing is just painful.When it's on, it's on. It's great sailing into battle, broadsiding other ships. Until everything slows down. It looks like there's a lot of fun metagame in the faction conflict, but you're gonna spend ages grinding before you get out of your baby ship.Wait until the developers get a clue before buying this. As it stands it's maybe worth $20, not the asking price.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								You've seen the trailers, right?Few games really live up to its trailers and all its marketing nowadays. This one surpasses it. The realism is there, to a much higher degree than any even remotely similar game I have ever seen. You have your physics, the sea and the wind and the structure of your ship, to take into account in every move you make. You have your graphics, as beautiful as you could wish. And the immersion is there - every battle you fight counts, for good or for bad.The ships range from the smallest cutters and schooners to the heavy first rate ships-of-the-line, and the variety in gameplay is enormous as you raise in the ranks. Furtheremore, the game offers other aspects of the naval Caribbean life than combat between nations - trading, crafting, plundering and politics.This game already has ten times more to offer than the average AAA game, and so far the game has been growing furiously in both size and quality, from the match-based combat game it once was, during the Sea Trails, to the masterpiece it already is, despite a few bugs and a very rudimentary GUI. And this despite its still being considered an alpha version. It offers no tutorial as such, but instead it gives you a cutter to do with as you please, and which you can replace for free once you manage to sink it or blow it up. In my personal opinion, this is the best tutorial you could wish for.And lastly, I know the price is by some people considered rather high for an early-access game, but I assure you: if you would be willing to buy any of those AAA games for 150% of this price, then you should not doubt going for this one too. And contrary to so many of those games, there has been no talk about any DLCs, suscription fees or any other of that crap yet. And that detail alone is very encouraging.See you on the high seas, captain.

content:
Posted: January 1
Early Access Review
								I regret having to write a review on an early access game but each patch to the game by the developers have taken it further from it's original purpose which is a "ship vs ship" game set in the Napoleonic wars era of tall ships.  The "action" in the title Naval "Action" is nothing but a lie.  As each patch gets progressively worse, the server populations have plummeted.   The developers have spent too much time trying to create a faulty open world with great but rare  instanced combat.   If you are entertained by hours of sailing for the purposes of  trading or crafting  with very little other player interaction, this may be the game for you.   There is standing joke among Naval Action players that Naval Action is the game you play while you play other games or watch Youtube videos.  At the present time I would not recommend investing time into the game.  I feel that I am seeing a game under development on the edge of failing and I predict that it will be nothing but a memory in less than six months.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								After around twenty hours of in-game time with Naval Action in it's current state (Alpha 9.94), I can recommend this title without a doubt. Some strong features about this game are as follows;Pros:- Beautifully designed world.- Accurate, detailed ships.- Excellent graphics and visuals.- Realistic combat and movement speeds (Whilst in battles).- Friendly and helpful community.- Alot of satisfactory for purchasing a ship after grinding.Furthermore, such as every game, there are downfalls and cons, however, I can definitely say that Naval Action is limited in it's cons. Some of those are as follows;Cons:- A large grind for ships and such (This was not an issue for me, however, some may stray away due to the large amount of grinding necessary)- Excellent starter cutter to start things off (Free repair kits, Unlimited durability, etc.)- A basic, modern-esque user interface.- A somewhat lack of variety of ships.Thus, I would give Naval Action the rating of 8.5/10, Recommending it for anyone who is willing to spend their time on learning the ropes of this fancy game. Please keep in mind that this game is in Early Access, and this game will NOT be perfect, there WILL be bugs, there WILL be issues, and if you're not willing to sacrifice those issues for playing an Early Access game, then you'll need to wait to purchase /any/ Early Access game -- Remember to read the fine text before purchasing!Cheers!

number of helpful: 19 of 32 people (59%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is still in early development as of 1/19/2016. I've played this game before it was on Steam, for many hundreds of hours. The game itself, is an open world game based in the Gulf of Mexico/Bahama's. East coast of America, Mexico, all the islands of the bahama's, and Jamaica, and East coast of South America. Travel:The travel in this game does take awhile. It's a HUGE map, however you don't NEED to travel great distances if you don't want too either. Immersion and Combat: The immersion in this game is very real, and realistic. Distance of the shot, the size of the cannon, the thickness and even type of wood the opponents ship is, the angle your ball hits, the velocity, all of this takes into account whether your ball penetrates, and even how it interacts INSIDE the opponents ship. That's right, a cannon ball can continue to bounce around a few times inside the ship, or blast out the opposite end. Waves and wind will affect your shot quite considerably in smaller vessels, and if you're fighting in a storm, your ship will bob left, right, up and down affecting your shot as well. Your cannon can only aim up, down, left and right to only a certain degree. You can board and capture enemy vessels, sink them, break them down for component parts to make your own ship, or sell captured ships. Port Battles: Port Battles is also a thing, attacking enemy ports or defending your own, complete with defensive towers and the works. If the attacker is the victor, they take permenant control of that port, or at least until you capture it back. Your Choice: How you play is entirely up to you, and what you do. You also do not have to "grind through the tiers". Small, medium, and large ships have vastly different play styles, and skills required to excel at them. If you find the the lower rate small ships suits your playstyle more, you can stay in them, and ignore the Man O Wars, and higher rate ships, and your fun will not be diminished at all. -----------The video's for this game do it justice, and are not "enhanced" in anyway. You truly can, even from day 1 get into quite frightening battles, or you can go into the less populated area's, and be somewhat safe from attack. If fighting isn't your thing, you can craft or trade as well. Finding a good market, and trade route can be extremely lucrative, and becoming a well known crafter can also be extremely lucrative as well, capable of making high end modules, or even first rate Man o Wars. ----------If you love open world games, love the time era this game is set in, and are genuinly interested in old ship combat, or simply trying to find a new game that that's both immersive, fun, and something you can easily play with friends. This is definetly a game worth getting.

number of helpful: 11 of 17 people (65%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Naval Action is the best you're going to get if you're going for a historic naval game.Many people complain about the grind that is Naval Action, but this is for the best, It's a simulator and sailing will take long, battles will take long, because that's just the way it was back then.This game does not take the casual approach many game developers take these days, It's not made for you just to shoot some ships and quit after a week. Sailing around the caribbean is not danger free, you will get attacked if you do not pay attention, and you will lose your ship. Other way around, you can take ships.(On the other side of the grind, If you own a decent ship, getting money is as easy as taking candy from a baby.)Many people complain about the developers because they don't "listen" to the community, this might be true on some occasions, but to say they don't listen is complete b*llsh*t. Just take a quick look on the game-labs forums, everything the developers do is based on player opinions, they players even vote for which ship gets added to the game next.This game is everything the 18th century caribbean had to offer, beauty, danger and hours of sailing. If you are looking for a historic naval game that's not a casual, easy peasy point and click shooter, Naval Action is for you.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								Not ready for prime time yet and probably never will be.Beautiful combat mechanics don't mean a thing when boarding combat is a *really* stupid card game and the UI in major sections of the game is unfinished and the fugliest in any game ever. Economy is so broken, players won't accept money when selling stuff - you can only trade not buy because money is worthless. Crafting is a joke and everyone has a fleet of 1st rates. Hardcore players yell at each other for breaking the game (driving players away) by too aggressively attacking foreign nations. (An MMO should never break simply from  attacking enemies). Sailing speed between ports is too slow and the map too big. Boredom yawns and anger mixed with occasional pvp. No avatar. No walking around ports. Anything you do in port is done on a spreadsheet (funny how you don't see those screenshots on the store page!!) And there isn't much to do in port at all.Basically the devs are clueless and impotent. They have created a game that is unfishished and designed to break. Servers (all two of them) are empty. Players gather at a pvp-meeting place and waste hours chatting waiting for someone to show up.  If you remember how badly the devs at Pirates of the Burning Sea broke the best game ever made, well, this game has equally clueless devs or worse. Servers go down daily for 1-2 hours and port battles are not scheduled at convenient times. Updates frequently make the game worse, not better. I would check back in a year, but don't expect much. Amazing potential that will never be realized. Do not waste your money, even on sale. Even if you are hardcore for sailing MMOs. Oh wait, this game never goes on sale - even with empty servers - that's how clueless the devs are!If you enjoy mindless hours driving a boat and playing it like Euro Truck Simulator with a chat window, this game might be for you.

content:
Posted: April 4
Early Access Review
								This game is barely alpha. It's a bad knockoff of Pirates of the Burning Sea.The interface is barley above a DOS level program and lacks even rudimentary functions to get you started. Combat is an exercise in frustration as NPC's are lethal while you can barely hit the broad side of a barn.Can this game be more enjoyable? Certainly, but not without a ridiculously steep learning curve that discourages anyone but a masochist from playing it. All it is, is a wooden ship combat simulator, and not a very good one at that. I accept that its in alpha test and it just embryonic right now, but there's no excuse for basic gameplay functions to be absent, like a working map function or a proper ship description. I am constantly told by the rather limited population that I will learn in time.Sorry, but if a game is not enjoyable from the get-go, it smacks of a failed attempt at cloning a far better version of another  put out years ago for the sake of capturing dollars. Lack of a finished game is one thing along with bugs, but an unenjoyable alpha is hot mess. I will continue to test the game and explore its limited gameplay value and change this review if the game changes as time goes by, but for now, avoid dropping retail money on a barely finished product. I'm sure I'm going to be roundly lambasted for this by the 50 or so people playing it.. so be it.UPDATE : Ok, I've now invested more hours in the game and I'm to at able least kill things and keep from getting killed all the time. That's something.But bottom line, the game is little more than a combat simulator, having no strategic or true MMO flavor to it-- its just mindless killing or getting killed and scraping up enough materials to build your fleet. Hardly worth the time you have to invest in it , to get good. A fresh interface instead of something out of the DOS era, and some true tools for players to interact and customize themselves would help enormously. Also a decent starting tutorial game which provides some immersion is needed before I could recommend this game to others for forty bucks.

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								Edit after some time: this is the first MMORPG ive put this many hours into in years and years. Truly something different.On the fence about getting this one seeing the high number of hours for many of the positive reviews. Took the plunge knowing I had 2 hours to decide before refund became unavailable. Glad I did. For the moment its like the old Pirates combined with World of Warships. Battles are just great, the detail level is a big step up from WOW, the battles are long and tense and swing back and forth as you land shots in the damaged areas and start to cause leaks below the waterline. UI - placeholder, does the jobTutorial - non existant but plenty around in the community, and honestly its not that hard. WSAD to control your ship, your cannons shoot where the mouse aims give or take, you have to wait for the moments when you have a good line due to waves not being in the way. Community helpful so far in PvE serverGrind - yes and no. Yes you have to fight a lot of fights to level up, XP rewards are proportional to the damage you do, and you need lots of slow earned XP - so you would be right in thinking that sounds like grind. Thing is that the battles are so good that I really don't get a sense of grind - this isnt right click on enemy, watch large hit point pool go down, use abilities etc etc, the battles are far better and give me a sense of both pleasure and achievement when I win through against the odds - more like Dark Souls, really skill based.So I really like this. Its absolutely an alpha in early access with a long long way to go to be polished, but you play it to do the ship combat and that is simply the best I've seen. Really interested to see just how good this can get, its clear that it has taken big steps in the direction of being one of the great ship games, comparisons to EVE online frequent and deserved, and could easily go all the way.Certainly worth the price of admission if you liked Pirates! or similar and want something with a really detailed damage engine, and excellent core game mechanics.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Right then, first of all I just want to say something about the negative comments: Alot of the bad review seem to be from people who know nothing about the game nor seem interested to learn, I.E saying there is 0 guides.. Try checking the game forum (And now it is on steam people are creating guides for quicker access). Waiting times to login. well yea thats going to happen as the game just hit early access via steam.. And that all too important message of It is Early Access!Right then, I was lucky enough to be apart of the early stages of pre alpha testing 2 years ago, the advancement that has been made in that time has just been great, the damage model is fantastic and altho basic to most people the graphics are beautiful. Back when we first got to play on the open world, ports had barely any textures, islands were blurred but it still looks great (A semi comparison would be like legacy rust to current rust.)There is so much more in the pipeline for this game and the devs have been fantastic. They listen and communicate with the tester and player base (Just go to the actual forums) This is a more hardcore realism age of sail game rather than an arcade style boat shooter.The learning curve can be quite steep for some but stick at it and there is the help chanel in chat for newbies to go nuts in.Once you experience a propper fleet battle with teamwork, the sounds n the imagary is just fantastic. You will love this game. If your not that into ships or the timeline then I doubt this game will be for you. It's nice to play a game where the devs put their love into it. 10/10 and still much more to come.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								I absolutely do recommend this game. Its a true blue sailing game that put its big boy pants on and actually made something that rides the balance between simulation and genuinely fun. The game itself is only partially fleshed out, and for whats there its already really awesome. The game has spent the past number of months in a closed alpha and the devs do seem to really care abou their game. The game is not your "Assassin's Creed" style of naval combat. Its a bit more slow paced and 'realistic' to a degree. The game promises to be something really great, with a player based economy and polical system that has a very pleasant Eve Online flavor to it. The foundations of the open world are already in place with trading, raiding, and basic missions from the Admiralty in place. Each faction (The Royal Navy, The Spanish, The Dutch, The US, Sweden god help you if you go Sweden, Pirates, and Denmark) has its own semi historic territorial holdings in the Caribbean and so far the focus of the game is to expand your faction's port holdings. The Devs promise chunky updates once a month from here on out and there will apparently be no more wipes. I'm hopeful for this game.

Early Access Review
								I really wouldnt listin to the negitive reviews of people whom have 30 hours or less into the game. people spouting off how bad the game is yet have 0.1 hours played. dont listin to them at all.The game is relaxing at sea. if you enjoy the sound of the ocean, the booms of cannons anda good paced game. this is it for you.You have PVP and PVE servers. you have a mini map. most of how you travel is by figuring out in real time where to go, and getting lost can be done with much ease.Pros would includeShip Vs Ship BattlesPort conqest ( you can take over some other nations port)Ship boarding, (you can board another ship and take it as you're own)Trading (not very fast paced but great if you want to earn some extra money)Ship crafting (yea, you can build ships here and sell them off)Graphics, (very nice graphics in the ships, the sea and the world)i miss the pig cloud thoughDamage control. (You can disable a ships rudder, rip his sails down. or shoot the maste off to disable his speed)ConsGetting lost (its easy to get lost if you dont know what you are doing. never go afk in open world sailing.)Losing you're ship (this is a pro and con here) If you lose a life on you're ship to zero, you lose the ship altogather, at the same time so does you're enemy)long traveling between distances.(Hey its a massive map, dont think something fun will come quick and easy kids, go play call of duty)All in all i say its a very fun and addicting game. i would kinda say it woul dbe like taking a crap in a handicapped bathroom. you have you're space, and have the little handle bars for power squatinThis game would be best most enjoyed if you like 2 of 3 things. Do you like ships old or new?Do you enjoy the ocean and sailing around?Do you love intense battles with bots or players?

number of helpful: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								EARLY ACCESS  ( things will change )...at this moment in time...Basically you sail around the Caribbean fighting, trading, crafting, in packs or solo for your chosen nationCombatWhen you attack someone in the open world you are drawn into an 'instance' pretty much like Elite Dangerous.There are a few Rules of engagement that are constantly being adjusted to try to help the lesser combatants so not much point commenting on those here as they're likely to change from one week to the next.Exeptional combat model that has only got better with time from the devs' and input from the community.Easy to get into if you are able to tie your own shoe laces but also complex enough to take time to master.Beautiful models sounds and sea textures.The combat model is pretty much the only thing that is near 100% finished and unlikely to change much and it shows, when comparing it to the rest of the 'game'...  it's simply stunning and even more so when you start to appreciate the subtleties.9/10   TradingTrading all revolves around resources and materials for building ships.To be honest it's very, very simple but it's still being fleshed out.I would like to see a massive economy driven trading system not just about materials for ships, but based around real items that were traded in the set time period.2/10Crafting Very strange crafting model that is very dull and a little RNG I'm not even sure it should be in at all but as with most things this will change and hopefully improve vastly.1/10Naval Action has the potential to be an absolutely stunning title that gives you a hint of what it was like to be in combat at sea in the set time period. I do recommend the game but... only to those people that are intelligent enough to understand it's not a casual game and requires considerable time investment all in a half finished title. It's probably why the price is hefty in an effort to weed out the less passionate gamers given everyone has an input in the developement.FootnotePlayer numbers peak after major updates and fall before them as they wait for content injection or character wipes, it's not uncommon and can happen from time to time...currently we are waiting for an update which is why the numbers are dropping. The experienced players aren't playing, not much point if you've played/tested everything so far and it will get wiped next week so don't take much notice of reviewers claiming the end of the world and the game is dying it's just the usual ebb and flow of early accessI shall return to this review in the future...

content:
Posted: February 3
Early Access Review
								This is not a game, it is a naval simulator, do not expect to succeed or to have a fun time. The game sets you up for failure in the true 1800's naval warfare fashion. Do not expect your Cid Meier Pirates experience, the game play is so slow you will not realize your mistake until it is too late to return it. The simulator is so accurate it does not allow for enjoyable gameplay. After sailing across the map for hours constantly checking your co-ordinance with the map, there is no "You are here" mark, you might find an enemy that is of lessor strength then you. Upon activating an instance with that ship of lessor strength, for a ship of equal value I never encountered and ships of a higher value destroy you out right, the ship immediately begins to flee. The pursuit will take up to a hour and half and usually ends with you either facing into the wind unable to pursue or a larger ship entering the battle and destroying you. The canon reload time is extremely fast for naval standards or remarkably slow when compared to the pace of other games. Battles are long and usually end in failure, ideal for those of us who don't rely on success to release dopamine. Who wants to succeed to have a good time when it is far more realistic to fail. The in port actions are not explained within the game and reading through the tutorials I have learned that there is an optimum way of doing things, no competitive tactics or free choice involved. If you want to do things your way you will waste time and lose harder. Overall, as a simulator this product is amazing! Remarkably true to life, it offers all the frustration of life on board ship at the turn of the 19th century. Be prepared to spend hours sailing and still more chasing after your opponents for little reward, a tiny amount of experience and to end your days haul up on a lee shore. After all, the mariners of the past spent their entire lives chasing after fortunes that were just over the next horizon. We can't all be Admiral Nelson and this game certainly drives that point home.

Early Access Review
								Probably one the of the best game... totally ruined by a terrible, starting, error.This is not a game (and sort of game) that could be "ported" on multyplayer: it's a real sim, real sims doesn't work as MMO!Every couple (and less) of years, a company come with a great idea and funds, trying to milk the alredy filled market of MMO with a Sim game...Never saw ANY of these working!There are so many problems building an MMO true Sim game that many are quiet obvious: sim game are difficult to learn and master and... sim game needs a command to accelerate time, and this is not possible playing an MMO game... sim game needs a lot of effort on system design and AI design, and this is incompatible with MMO.And today? This game would have worked PERFECTLY as a standalone singleplayer game and, instead, you have a game that WORKS like a singleplayer game and TRY to attract MMO players.Results? Already two years of work and frankly... we see an ALPHA stage? Maybe a little more?So, you appreciate a lot of things, but, at the end, this game as MMO is simply boring and very, very slow!It's also too simple!I only wait to see this finally being released as an, improved, single player game, but don't waste your time and money if you want to play an MMO.

content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game has a lot of promise, if you like sailing ships then this might be the game for you, however this is early access, there is quite a few problems and bugs as you should expect from an early access game.However, the devs do try their best to help. Eg, I got stuck because the game spawned me in shallow water, within 10 mins of me posting on the forums, a dev had responded and sorted the problem for me.Pros:-Good Graphics and sounds-Realistic ship/combat mechanics-Nearly everything in game can be crafted-Runs pretty well on low end computers-Alot of different ships, from small cutters up to 1st Rates ship of the lines-Different ways to play. PvP, PvE, trading or crafting.-Great dev support.Cons:-Can take hours to get somewhere-Alot of grinding to get the better ships-Gankers (when I first started I kept getting attacked by someone in a vastly superior ship, had to quit and go with a more      powerful nation)-No ingame tutorialCommunity (from British point of view)-Big clans control nearly everything, they tend to give ports to allies without informing the lower players who use those ports. I understand we needed to give our allies the ports, but there is no way ingame to notify the players who use that port unless you log in everyday.-Players control too much, For example, USA is getting owned atm by the pirates (who for some reason are classed as a nation) and Sweden nearly got wiped out by the french and danes.-Most player will try to come to your defense if you're attacked (if you're close enough)-Teamwork is needed to surviveIf you want a game where you can just jump on for an hour or so and shoot people with massive warships, this is not the game for you, it will take days to get to the bigger ships.If you want a game where you have to work hard, be part of a large community, help defend your nation against all her enemies, then this might be the game for you.8/10

content:
Posted: January 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Amazing game, large PvP battles are epic!! Countries fight for domination, captains for fame - it is simply just THE game. EDIT: You begin the game with as a low rank captain with a low amount of crew in a ship called "Cutter", which is a 12 gun ship (40 crew). When I started playing, it was a looooong way to the top rank, grinding alot of XP towards getting more crew and thereby a larger ship. Max crew under ones command is 1050, which is needed to fully crew the largest ships in the game. The 1st rate battles are EPIC but already as a captain with 200 crew, you will be able to sail frigate class ships with 40 guns, like the famous Suprise. The 200 crew rank is a milestone as a player in this game, because it really kicks off here! This is where you have to learn to manually control sails and PvP will be much more fun. 5 guys in frigates can do some serious damage and take out the largest ship if done right.Its possible to craft your own ships, but this takes some time. When you buy the game and create an avatar, you are given "labor hours" (LH) - 42 LH pr. real time hour. These hours can be used to craft materials and in the end combine these and craft a ship. To create materials, resources are ofcourse needed. Ress are produced and consumed in all ports around the map, which means you must sail in trader ships and buy where its cheap(being produced) and earn money by selling in ports that consume a certain resource, if you are meaning to earn cashe - ofcourse pirates or enemies of ones nation are lurking on the seas, around the cays and isles - so dont sail with high value without an escort. Many players like myself are hunting for lone traders, this may take hours but the loot can be worth it. The game is really exciting that way. In this game, you are an asset to your nation, every gun is needed in the large coordination of fleets and clans within a nation. Every nation has been on the verge of destruction, which require all hands on deck and collaboration!- Part of the community is really toxic, put these guys in the ignore list ASAP. - Often its hard for new players to survive - find a good clan in your nation, but be careful. Toxic players tend to team up as well, be sure to join the good guys ^^ - It takes time to master a ship in battle, gaining the wind, keeping the upper hand and wrecking your opponent. All ships have different stats, speed, turning, speed compared to degrees in the wind etc etc. Thats why it can take some time to learn the small things but the depth is also amazing. The game is still under development and within the next few days a new patch will be implemented. This will reset the map and RoE will be changed completely - I look forward to this.o7

								The best Naval Simulator out there. Even though I have over 25 hours in the game I have explored less than 5% of the map and tested only 2 ships yet. You have to come to terms with the fact that this game is a marathon, not a sprint. If you are ok with investing time and effort into learning the machanics of sailing, gunnery, tacking and so on then there is nothing better out there currently. It's a realistic simulation and won't give you things like map markers, you have to navigate with your compass. Killing enemy ships takes a lot of skill and time but once you get good at you get this awesome feeling which only comes from knowing that you worked towards it and not just clicked your mouse at a reticule. You will spend about 20 hours just learning the basics (preferably against the AI) and then buying a real ship which will be your gateway to the caribbean. Don't be intimidated by the learning curve though, there are a lot of helpful videos and many helpful people in-game as well. Even if you want to just relax after a long day at work, you can just hop into your little pile of oakwood, pick a heading and sail the high seas!

number of helpful: 63 of 120 people (53%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Update: All this time later and with the game ready for "release" a bunch of ill-conceived and later reverted open world changes it is still hot garbage, all this open world nonsense was a huge waste of time and effort game is basically dead/dying. Scrap all the open world stuff which at the end of the day is jank and tedious, and make this a world of tanks style game with sail which with some tweaking could be really good. Instead actual combat improvements and design which had appeared to be the strong starting base were not devloped in favor of a huge boring tedious and ultimately pointless "open world".Short Version: Would of been great if developed as a War Thunder/World of Tanks style lobby match making game. Instead its promising but unpolished ship fighting buried beneath countless hours of extremly rough "MMO" systems and griding.It has potential and the ship combat is pretty excellent unfortunatly the MMO mechanics of the game are something awful. By far the fastest and most effecient way to get into larger ships are to run "missions" which as of now consist entirely of go to X kill Y. PvP and open lobby style battles are great but bot and mission grinders are already showing up in these with much more capable ships and dominating. The "Open World" map is extremely boring there is really not much going on. There is weather but it does not have any impact in the open world map. You basically stare at water for 15min-hours+ depending on how far you need to go aand with no map marker, you cant really even alt-tab. You may see some other faction and attempt to PvP them but the rewards for the missions are usually much higher and involve less risk. The main problem is the by far best way to progress to competitive ships is the dullest part of the game. It involved sailing to a marker on the map which does not have a marker representing you so you have to navigate by feel. Then you fight one of 2/3 npc ships that spawn for that mission type. The AI does not present a real challenge but the battles still take between 10-40 minutes. PvE gameplay is not bad some people like that but it is really unpolished in this game. Grouping with friends significantly hurts progression. The AI is not the worst but not capable of presenting much of a challenge either. Its always the same battle this one ship easily but slowly win type gameplay.IF they are able to change the focus of this sandbox ships game to PvP at least on the PvP server this could be a great game. They need to at least triple the exp gained in PvP small and large battle lobbies. They need to find a way to diversify the ships used beyond free ship/brig-snow/SoL, again by offering increased xp/gold for people not using a free ship.This game does a bunch of things right but then puts the focus and highest rewards on the least polished and most dull part of the game.

number of helpful: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								For us old seadogs like myself EA used to stand for Electronic Arts and their advert that ended with "It's in the game". Nowadays EA stands for Early Access but somehow there are those that expect an EA game to be feature complete(!?). For those that have been here since the devs first starting selling access keys and watched it grow from one PvE instance until now with Open World being just so incredibly huge this game has enough to justify the price for those who don't demand a $100mill game for their $40.Upsides;Slower paced game that simulates the forethought which went into sailing and fighting in Age of Sail ship. A much better "thinking man's shooter" than others in the store.No crashes (using the x64 build) and only a couple of graphical glitches and minor, non-gameplay breaking bugs.Very good graphics. No, you can't disembark and walk around the port but that is a small nitpick that takes nothing away from the core game.Downsides;A slower game time-scale wise than many will be wanting to put up with - As one commented in chat the other day if you want to sail from one side of the map to the other plan on doing something other while your ship is sailing (studying, websurfing, etc). Not for the "I want it now, right now" crowd.Simple UI - This is one point that needs addressing soon. Something a bit more immersive such as the old "Pirates!" game would be nice but admittedly we still have many months to go before we can expect something of that scale to be implemented.A slow grind and even slower for those explorer and social gamers types. The first couple of ranks could be made a bit faster to rank up in. Me being an explorer type played 8+ hours yesterday and am still an Ensign. Those that learn how to make the most efficient use of their time will rank up faster tho' don't expect to rank up like you're playing WoW while wearing full heirloom gear.TL;DRA fun relaxing game that doesn't require the best hand-eye coordination but instead relies on speed management and positioning. Crafting and trading is deep and the player base is generally well-mannered and helpful.

number of helpful: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10
Early Access Review
								Played less than 30 minutes. Learned all I need to do:PROS-Great graphics-Realistic ships (minus the fact that no crew can be seen on deck which looks stupid)-Combat and sailing mechanics are challenging but realistic-Helpful player base, but insanely small (all servers have around 50 per grouping meaning the max player count was around 150, even though it's likely because it's morning, I highly doubt that the playerbase is much larger than that)-Lots of depthCONS-It's not an MMO. It's just a sandbox sailing game. There's no real involvement with building up your ship other than trying to get the next, best ship.-The player base is tiny.-Way too much time investment for little payoff. There are no tutorials, no help files, and the suggestions you get from chat are to watch YouTube videos or the Wiki. -Devs seem to be super shady.All in all, it's not worth 40 bucks. At all. Not for a game that expects you to do all of the work to learn how to play and what to do. There are better games out there with similar themes (Blackwake for example) that are better supported, have more players, and developers that aren't afraid of critiscism.

Early Access Review
								A beautiful gigantic playground filled with stunning sunsets,huge storms,fog and changing wind  and sea conditions.Craft simple ropes to exceptionally crafted ships.Open up outposts,build warehouses.Trade for income or for your manufacturing needs.You can sell goods to ports but also create contracts for desired goods from other players or sell your own manufactered goods via contracts to other players.Board ships and take ownership and keep the cargo.Battles filled with smoke,waves and flying wood splinters.There are PVE servers for the single player minded  as well as pvp though the same character can enter the pvp server and keep rank and xp then reenter PVE server again keeping rank and experience.Money,ships are not transferable between servers.In PVP ports can also be taken by 1 of 8 factions in game.All this is in the  Early Access launch.Dev's say there is still lots more to come.

content:

Early Access Review
								The current state of this game (as of 28/06/2016 is not palletable for any new players, especially with a hefty price tag of £30 for a supposed "alpha" game..although the main redeeming feature that makes this game unique is the combat instances, I feel like there is a lot more to be desired outside of this - the open world map is large and takes time to travel however the rewards for travelling to certain places for trade is not benefitted, or is not sufficient, meaning this game is purely shooting stuff repetitively for many hours.The devs have released a yearly patch document stating what they will do each month, except they just seem to rework some of the combat system and not really add anything, for instance the UI in ports is utter garbage ( a giant blue slab with white text and some varied colour for rarity types on ships ) There is nothing to do ingame other than fight other ships in an extremely limited range of missions (just tiering up how hard they are with the level you pick, and either being single of fleet missions, the difference being fleet missions have more than two ships involved in the instance to face against)If the devs focused on fixing the open world aspect of this game, and rewarding players for playing differently than just shooting stuff for many hours it would be worthwhile, the alternative, capturing ports, it dull and not worth the effort, time and resources either.TLDR: Devs need to get their♥♥♥♥♥♥together and fix the OW aspect, they need to add things to the game and stop reworking them whenever somebody cries about something they dont like and get their heads out of their♥♥♥♥♥and pull this game out of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. (The updates they do release are so infrequent i wonder if this is slowly becoming abandonware to be perfectly honest) Such a shame, this unique game had great potential, seems like they took their money and pegged it to me.

content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								1. Best Age of Sail combat simulation there is. 2. The game is open world and has own server like an MMO where there are hundreds of players. 3. Play as Pirates, USA, Great Britain, French, Spanish etc.4. The map is huge centering around the Gulf of Mexico, Bahamas and the Caribbean Sea and travelling across the map would take hours. Each of the 100+ port is conquerable.5. Graphics are great. Sea and weather looks realistic and ships look detailed and authentic.6. Wind condition plays important part in sailing, so are ship sailing profiles. 7. A large selection of ships, ranging from tiny cutters, to small brigs, to midsize frigates, and to large ships of the line, including the HMS Surprise, HMS Victory, and USS Constitution.8. Trading & ship-crafting is also important in this game. 9. Some ships are only craftable by players, such as the trader ship Indiaman and other high grade ships.10. A large selection of armaments, ranging from tiny 4 pd cannons to 308 pd mortars.11. Combat, albeit slow paced, is very realistic and deliberate, down to the very details of boarding. 12. The game is early access but very playable, though the UI is a bit rough.13. The game community is very helpful and active, and does regular port battles in large 10+ ship fleets. 14. The game is constantly improving and even if a bit expensive is worth the price for something so special.

Except for the poor looking boarding menus. Boarding works but it isn't fun and they'll have to change it for it to be fun.  -It is open world and kind of reminds me of POTBS MMO if any of you played that.  There is a map but it doesn't ping your location so you have to rely on terrain and your compass right now. Also the missions are indicated by crossed white swords which can be hard to see during the day ( I suggested they change the color of those).-The port screen is ugly but fully functional. It does have a little messege saying Test UI please ignore so it will change. Making it pretty is something probably low on their priority list and that is ok.-The ships are beautiful but I'd like to see more customization of colors on the wood/designs, possibly sail color (but not a big deal), and a maybe a custom captain avatar sailing the ship. Right now every ship is the same color in its class, the deck's cannons do change style depending on what you have equipped,  and there is a very generic crew representation (which is ok enough for me, but some might want more here).-Sound effects and smoking cannons are great but the game doesn't have a music track yet, so I use my own in the background.-there is crafting, trading, and gathering resources to build ship which is nice. There is even a chance at making better ships such as exceptional.-there is clans, PvP, PvE, and co-op play so it has it all there. Not only can you craft, sell/buy ships, but you can also capture them in combat which is always nice(again boarding isn't fun right now though).     Overall I enjoy  the game because I like naval combat and love playing it with friends over voice chat. However I also like customization and role playing which is lacks, but I can see them building on. I can see this game going a long way and recommend in its alpha state if you want a good naval combat game with the understanding the RPG element of it is growing and not complete yet.

number of helpful: 12 of 21 people (57%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								To be read with British accent…….Cannons & wooden ships, what could possible go wrong? Down to Davy Jones’ locker you go!Well not most of the time……Based on the age of sail, wait, for those dimwits who can’t understand “age of sail”, that means your boat does not have a motor (NO♥♥♥♥♥♥ it uses the wind for power. Boats at this time were made out of wood, so don’t expect to be driving the Bismarck around the Caribbean. Enough of the intro lets move on shall we?Open World: Real life locations, beautiful sea, pirates, ports where you upgrade your ship or buy a new vessel, create a fleet (if you have the gold and experience), start battles, join your allies’ battle, attack merchant ships for expensive goods (my fav). Choose from a loads of nations: The British Empire (my fav XD), the French Empire (boooooo), the US (“damn colonial rebels” says in British accent), the Spanish Empire (filthy Spanish! I hate them…idk why but I do XD), the pirates (cowards and scum. I always go for theses ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s first). Plus a few more nations that I forget….sorry XD. Naval Combat:Use your brain and you will survive (hopefully). Don’t expect to start off with a first rate ship of the line with 108 guns (most powerful type of ship in the game). You, yes, you young captain you start off with a small 12 gun cutter. Sad and pitiful, you will work you way up to get better and bigger ships. Combat is fun and realistic. Cannons sounds like cannons do. Smoke textures aren’t bad would like to see something of a high resolution. Boats look beautiful. You can fire one cannon at a time or all of them (what we call a broadside). You can destroy the enemy’s sails, kill their crew members, or just batter the ships hull until she sinks (what I do most of the time). And there is also the option to flee……cowards use that tactic often. You’re not one of them are you? If you wanted to……you could always capture the ship! Sinking them is much more fun. OVERALL:It’s a blast. Community isn’t fill with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Listen to pirates of the Caribbean theme with this game….will thank me later. Fought a brig in a cutter, lasted 5 mins 10/10 would get reckt again. Don’t do that plz. The devs still have lots to work on. Game needs better animation, cannons need to recoil, easier way to get to better ships. In the end the question you have to ask yourself is….would you to rule the Caribbean and slaughter the enemies of your empire through naval combat? Yes, Yes you would.If you see me in game say hello and I hope, we conquer the Caribbean together! I always play as the British Empire, just letting all of you know. Good luck young captains! May God go with you.

								First let me just say the game looks great and has alot of potential. Now having said that at this point it is horrinly frustrating to try to pley as a noob. Biggest complaint is the map. some good info there but the thing you would need the most (show your location) is not there, instead u have to zoom in and try to use co-ordinates to approximate your location, while this is relaistic navigating, it lends little enjoyment to the game when you are new and cant find a damn mission  because not only is the navigating on map horrible, the mission locations are vague so you end up sailing around for literaly hours looking for something. content:
Posted: December 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is early release so many of thee things may change. IMO this game is not worth purchasing until its finished as it seems to have lost difinitive direction. Too many easily manipulated player functions which effects everyones gameplay (politics). A skewed and listless economy and crafting system which they cant seem to get a handle on. I've put much time into all of those aspects , and without any positive direction , and almost no communication (or any doccumntation at all ) at this point from the developers I cant honestly recomend this to "casual" gamers. If you like grinding for hours , sitting in wait for large battles , or simply enjoy sailing near empty waters ( at this point) for the sake of an age of sail game, than you may enjoy this and feel the money is worth it. If you have but a short time to play (couple hours) you may not. Again , all of this may change as it develops. Time will tell. Its still an alpha and your basically paying to test a game where major functions may change not to your liking. You need to decide if that is worth it to you

content:
Posted: February 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								The reviews for this game are very strange.  I guess if you like EXTREMELY slow paced games with very little content then you'll love this game.  If you enjoy sailing around for hours on end with nothing much to look at, you'll love this game.  If you enjoy seeing a game that did almost zero research into historicaly based game play, you'll love this game.  So as you can tell I'm not to fond of this.  It does have potential, and yes they say it's in "Alpha", but from what I'm reading on the forums they may not be implementing some of the features this game needs to make it actually "fun".   Currently it's tedious and the grind is unreal.  Even though during age of sailing they portray in this game had a lot of accurate ways to navigate the seas, this game has ZERO!  Yes, ZERO!  You have a compass that tells you direction.  You have no way to set compass headings from your map, your map has ZERO interraction with your compass.  You can't navigate by using the stars....no really, you can't!   This is a deal breaker for me, just lame.Long story short....avoid this game unless you like to sail around and look at subpar graphics and enjoy a long grinds to get marginal rewards and enjoy a mildly entertaining combat system.

number of helpful: 19 of 35 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								DO NOT BUY!!! 95% of this game is Sailing in the open ocean for hours at a time, with nothing to do at all. the 5% of actual combat that you do encounter withh either end up in the person running for hours at a time, or being overwhelmed by enemies and dying/losing your ship that takes weeks to make. The only way anyone can actually play this game is if you own 5+ accounts and use alts to do the hours of sailing so you can actually get on and actually get into the combat. there are about 100 players MAX on their main servers. overall about 300-500 people actually play this game. and thats not counting alt accounts. For example, one night our clan decided to take some enemy ports, we saw there were 100 people online, so we asked everyone in teamspeak how many alts they have logged on, it turned out that we made up the entire server population at the time which was about 20 guys logged in our teamspeak, which really put the scope of how many people actually played this game lol, nooneNow for the 5% of the game that is actually decent. The actual combat. Mostly it is people teleporting in and out of different ports all over the map and waiting hours for a ship to eventually show on the horizon, then they will call their friends who have also been teleporting around at different ports for hours to then teleport over to him, and they will 5v1 that poor guy who spent hours sailing somewhere witha  max hold which equals to about 5% of resources for crafting a ship. The combat is extremely slow, generally max speed is about 15 mph in battle. Also the "Boarding combat" is a joke its a "minigame" of rock paper scissors. There is no first person aspect nor does your "crew move around the ship" they just stand there like foosball mannequin's. There is no blood, the damage on ships is purely cosmetic in battle, with the esception of breaking a mast.Overall if you like wasting hours upon hours sailing around with no "action" then this is the game for you. If you thought this was an action packed game then you are sadly mistaken.P.S. The devs told most of their playerbase to leave good reviews for this game and the community will be "rewarded with updates" now months have past and they never rewarded the community who left good reviews lol. So most of the positive reviews on this game were from devs trying to trick their community so they can increase their sales.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ok, I will give you a little back ground. I loved POTBS. Thought it was a great game right up till they sold off. I was kind of excited to see this game. A friend was playing it and verry excited about it. I himed and hawed about getting into another navy game. So I decided to take the plunge, and now sorry I did. To be honest I cant say all things are bad. The sea graphics are exelent. The cannon fire and aiming great. The crafting system seams good too, I like the labour hour storage. Now over to the dislikes.1.  I am sure that in the 1700's they where using sextant. So why do I not know where I am in the game. 2. Ship speed, Why am I going so slow in a small boat and turning like a barge. I do understand that a large ship going with the wind and all of it sale can over take a small ship. I do understand tacting the wind in a small boat. But when I get in a battle with a small boat against a big ship, skills in knowing this are of no use when my speed in manurving are nerfed. One like thought out of this they do have the dead spot, They should also have with it the ability to take the other ships wind that is running form you.3. Nice spread sheat for a port. Am I back in dos? I undrstand this is alpha and It will probally change. But with so much detail to the ships and the beautiful ocean., they could have sat down and done something better.4. Attacking ships as a team, I dont understand why I have to go out side the circle to enter the battle that I am trying to join with a team mate. If you are in a group you should be pulled in together.Right now I wouild give this game a 5/10, I will be watching and trying it after patches to look for improvements.  I am not going to recommend at this point just because of the price point.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								Interesting game that takes place in the Age of Sail period between 1700-1800 ish. With very interesting open world features in and more content being added often. Patches are made monthly and hotfixes are implemented when needed. Admin is not afraid to test new features or tweak things for testing purposes.Atm there is a lower then usual population due to a Coming Wipe of Ships and Gold but you will keep your Xp, Rank and Crafting Xp. But that means you can test things and not have a fear of losing them as all will lose ships and gold eventually.Its still in early development and it lacks a lot of finished and polished details but still very fun to play if you enjoy this period and the Age of Sail theme.Changes are made and new ships are being added. There are quite a few things to improve in this game still and many things will be improved but even at this stage the game is entertaining and fun.Start with a lowly cutter and fight your way up the ranks until you have earned the crew that allows you to outfit a 1st Rate Ship of the line Nelsons Victory, Or the spanish giant Santissima if you can build or afford one. But dont rush it as every ship type has its advantages and drawback and testing them all are a large part of the fun.You can also advance your crafting talents and become a ship builder that help your nation by supplying your fellow captains with ships for trading or cannon thunder, for a fee to be negotiated.Or a shrewd trader that buys low and sells high, Transport needed goods from a port with a surplus to a port that lacks your commodity and is willing to pay a premium price.Join a Clan to seek adventure or combat Pirates, take part in RVR vs other Nations on which your nation can vote to have War or Alliances with. Join a Fleet to stage a Portbattle and conquer a enemy region filled with ports and resources for your nation and deny the enemy of its use.Now you can pass the time with fishing while on the open the seas for exotic and valuable fish and the very rare Bottle with a map that can lead you to a shipwreck filled with treasure.The choices are yours, But remember The open sea can be a dangerous place.There be captains of other nations with whom you are at war, The smuggler who is trying to bring contraband to your nation or is smuggling for your enemies, or even the Pirates who wish to plunder your ship and its cargo to pay for a night in Tortuga with his ladies and rum bottles.The adventure is there but remember, Once you leave the safety of your nations port who knows what lies beyond the horizon.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've only had the privilege of playing Naval Action alpha for the month prior to early access but I've found it to be fun and it's got great potential. It's a slower paced game with moments of high drama. Players that enjoy games like Eve online, POTBS or Elite Dangerous would probably enjoy this.Sailing the ships is a joy, the devs have really nailed that part of the game. It does take some practice to get any good at it especially the gunnery and manual sail control. You actually have to aim your shots here, there’s no tab target and use ability type stuff.The graphics are really well done they can be taxing on some systems though and at this point the port UI still is unfinished. The game world is large and as a result getting from A to B takes time. This gives you plenty of opportunity to chat with other players, plan you next crafting project or plot your next attacks. This may annoy players that expect things to be fast paced, others like me really enjoy a relaxing sail from island to island.The game supports both PvE and PvP players with both types of servers available, the difference being you can’t attack other players in the open world on the PvE server.  PvP options include fighting on the open world, arena type battles and port battles for territory control. For the less violent types there is crafting, trade and hunting NPC’s on the open world map. There’s also a rudimentary mission system, currently only simple kill NPC missions but they’re pretty challenging none the less. One thing I must say is the game is very stable I've not had a single crash in 100 hours of play and the only bugs I've reported have been typos in the test. There’s still a lot of ideas and improvements to be added though so the next few months are going to be exciting.

								I was a huge fan of Sid Meier's Pirates! back in the day. More recently I enjoyed the MMO Pirates of the Burning Sea. If you liked both of those games, you'll love this one. If you can't get past that, this game has a lot of potential, so follow it.There are NO official tutorials yet. I recommend you read and watch the videos members of the community have created before you start playing or you will be a little lost. There is a thread on the official forums that contains them.

content:
Posted: March 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								FIRST: It's an alpha. Many systems are missing, many are unrefined. It's fun but don't expect a full game yet!This said, as a fan of C.S.Forester novels, I love this game. I have bought it on an impulse after playing Windward just to relax and boy, was it the right decision.Currently what has received major focus is the naval combat (surprise!) - it feels good! While a bit overwhelming at the beginning and the interface not being in any way final, after spending a couple of hours and reading around (no manual, no tutorial yet but plenty of guides on the forum and youtube) I started enjoying myself immensely. I really believe the combat captures the right spirit of the era and to any sailing ship fun this will be a delight. After overcoming the initial part I realised I was craving for even more complex mechanics to tackle (and which are on the way).The open world part certainly still needs work but the beginnings are all there. It is very rough on the edges but with time and feedback it can only improve, especially because the dev team actively listens to the players and tries to fix issues and rework system to make it the most fun possible.So if you like naval combat and are not afraid of PVP (let's be honest, that's where the fun is)  then grab your portion of rum, hoist your sail and sail on towards adventures and glory!

Early Access Review
								This game is like if Syd's Pirates were a 2D, topdown view, openworld shooter this game would be a 3D roving 3rd person view, openworld sailing combat simulator. I put in ten hours and it was so fantastic I wanted to say something.The world looks beautiful. The combat is suitibly complex for the goal of being a tall-ship sim. Gunnery is hard and fantasticly seemingly phsics based with every cannon moving somewhat uniquely (truly gorgeous). The damage model seems relatively realistic for a computer game. The community seems very active helpful and enthusiastic at least at this time. It's a pretty cool game imho.  You  have to sail the Carribean looking for booty. It's hard to go wrong with a concept like that for me. This game is seriously relaxing and stable for me. Absolutely no crashes yet.The hydrodynamics are gorgeous. The sea looks it should look and has a realistic day night cycle (not to scale). As sombody that enjoys sailing this game inpressively invokes the experience while complicating gunnery with the constantly changing levels in a storm.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Finally Naval Action will hit the EA.To get some Informations for new players I am going to write this review.I've been playing the game since May 2015 (Alpha State).About:Naval Action is a mmo open-world sandbox ship fight game. The ships are from the age of sail. At the moment this review was written there are no other games like this.You play as a captain, sailing a ship along one of several nations including GB, Swedish, US, French, Spain, Danish and even pirates. As a nation you need to stick together, to gain more exp and defeat your ports against the hostile nations.Yea thats right, you need to defend your ports. As the game is pvp based all the ports of a nation can be obtained by hostile nations, what leads to huge port battles that gain you extra exp aswell. The fight-system is instance based. So you sail along the openworld map located in america and join battles with your friends or start a battle against an enemy ship you see on the water. The huge maps and hundreds of ports make it even very interesting for players just wanting to explore everything and look at the beautiful graphics. As you fight enemy ships (PVP or PVE) and do quests you will rise in rank. This allows you to hire more crew members needed to control large ships. The ships itself can be upgraded and sticked with different cannon types, for example short range carronades that give u a lot of damage but won't work if another player just destroyes you from range with his long cannons. This gives the game a nice tactical touch, especially when participating in big PVP battles (like 40 players for example).Features:- Nation based gameplay to garanty PVP (PVE Server is availible aswell if you dont like PVP)- Port battles (obtain the enemy port and use it as your new headquarter!)- Crafting System (for ships, upgrades and cannons. To get the best stuff, you need to craft it)- Trading System (ports produce ressources needed for crafting, but not every port produces the stuff you need)- Open-World - Instance based battles- Boarding-Feature (You can capture enemy ships and its holding)- Different ammunition types for tactical use (demasting, kill crew, destroy ships)- Different Upgrades and Cannontypes (make your ship suit your playstyle!)I totally recommend this game and are looking forward for new players joining our current playerbase. At the end of the alpha testing we are around 500-1000 players already. Please be aware that the game is still in early access. Thats why there is no "nice" User-Interface in the ports implemented yet. But the fightsystem and graphics on water are absolutly fantastic.See you on the map, captain!
